content.question: A curve is defined by parametric functions <math alttext="x of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="the derivative of x, with respect to t, equals 3 times t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to t, equals t to the seventh power, minus 2 times t to the fourth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. For what positive value of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x, equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.2: (BC ONLY) Second Derivatives of Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
